thread.title: TDS returns for reunion and gig at The Criterion
thread.title_full: TDS returns for reunion and gig at The Criterion

title: TDS returns for reunion and gig at The Criterion
text:
TDS returns for reunion and gig at The Criterion 2nd Oct 2015 12:00 PM SHOWING UP: Transvaal Diamond Syndicate will play Yamba on Saturday night. Popular Stories Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
HARD-working Australian blues/rock act Transvaal Diamond Syndicate is stepping back into the fray with a single release, controversial clip release and national tour announcement this week. 
With just two weeks' rest from the last six-week tour endeavour, the ex-Rockhampton band is at it again with another six weeks scheduled all over the country including first-time runs to Western Australia and the Northern Territory to support the new single. 
Visiting Rockhampton on Saturday to play the Criterion Hotel and his school reunion, lead-singer Christian Tryhorn said it was always cool coming home to play for family and friends. 
"We're bringing a heap of new tracks and a new drummer with us this time," he said. 
"I'm actually playing my 20-year Emmaus reunion on the same night so it should be a heap of fun." 
The energetic trio raised more than $10,000 in 40 days recently to help cover the expenses of recording with a successful crowd-funding campaign, reaching 106% of their target in an obvious display of goodwill and support for the popular act. 
The new single rolls into '70s psych-rock territory for the band, with guest appearances from Lachy Doley, Zed Charles and more. 
The band, never afraid to release edgy material, has pushed the envelope once again with a track and film clip highlighting the issue of violence in society, particularly against women in a six-minute black and white epic. 
The new sounds will feature heavily on the first EP release, The Shadow. IF YOU GO WHO: Transvaal Diamond Syndicate w/ support act WHERE: Criterion Hotel, Rockhampton WHEN: Saturday, October 3, from 9pm Entry: Free
